episode_event_sub_ep_swsh_2021/6603_1201:
Oh? What a coincidence. Three singers, all in
one place.

Yeah, it surprised me, too! I thought I saw some
rockin’ outfits, and when I got closer, it was
you two!

I was guided here because I felt some passionate
souls in the area! Guess we stars tend to gravitate
toward each other!
I’ve heard both of your music, an’ I must say—

Look, it’s Piers, Roxie, and Ryuki! Could it be...
they’re going to play some songs?

I wasn’t planning on singing, but looks like people
are raring to go...

I’m down for a jam session! Let’s give ’em what
they want!

Yeah! Sometimes you just gotta roll with it,
you know?

Take a look at that, Piers. Your partner’s ready to
go, too. We’re set to rock this joint!

I s’ppose coincidences like this don’t happen every
day. All right, then. Let’s give everyone a song to
commemorate the occasion!

After all...the only thing humble singers like us can
do is continue singing our humble songs.
episode_event_sub_ep_swsh_2021/6604_1201: Leon, I think that capes should be more simple!
Really? I like what’s going on with mine, though.

When you’re the Champion and greet new
challengers with a swoosh of your cape...

I understand that the details of your cape speak
volumes about who you are. But for me, the
simplicity of my cape helps me stand out more!

I see! I never thought of it that way. I view my
cape as a reminder of all the people who are
cheering for me.

Lance, I do get what you say. Sometimes, simple
is best.

But other times, being in the center of a busy
piece makes the main subject stand out
even more!
That’s why I think that cape is great on Leon!

Now that you mention it, I do see that! It’s almost
as if it embodies the weight of all of Galar resting
on his shoulders! It’s unique!

But also...I didn’t realize you knew so much about
capes, Steven.

Well, I was just thinking about my philosophy on
rocks. But I think preference and personal style
apply to capes, too.

I’m not sure I understand exactly what you mean, 
but...I think I kind of get it! You two both have
your own kind of champion time!
episode_event_sub_ep_swsh_2021/6605_1201:
So the problem is that you want to smile better
to thank everyone cheering for you but aren’t
sure how?

Yeah. You have that Battle Royal thing in
Alola, right?

I hear there are a lot of people who come to
watch those battles, so I was wondering if you
had any tips on how to smile right.

Well...I’m not sure if I’m the right person to help
you with something like that.

Hau, what about you? You’d be able to give her
a few tips, right?
Huh? I don’t think there’s really any trick to it.

Oh, but now that you mention it...I can’t help but
smile when I start to think about going on the
island challenge together with everyone!

Yeah! We go from island to island in the Alola
region to take on a bunch of trials!

Hmm... I guess it must be kind of like a
Gym Challenge.

I remember when we first met, Gladion always
had a really scary look on his face!
Hmph. No idea what you’re talking about.
It was a lot of work—but loads of fun!
A lot of hard work, huh...

Ah! You just smiled! What were you thinking of
just now?
But thanks! I think I’ve got the hang of it now.
episode_event_sub_ep_swsh_2021/6606_1201:
That’s amazing! So the Wild Area is just a huge
expanse of land!

Yeah! If you look at a map of Galar, it’s
slap-bang in the middle and spreads out really
far from north to south!

The weather there changes frequently, so I’d often
camp out there with my Pokémon to take breaks
while out exploring!
That sounds like so much fun!

I wonder what kind of Pokémon live there!
I definitely wanna go there someday!

You know, all that talk about camping and then
seeing Eevee here just reminded me of something!

During the Gym Challenge, I once camped out with
another adventurer who had Eevee and all of
its Evolutions!

We played with all the Pokémon, and they were
all so fluffy and cute!
Oh, that must have been so nice!

There are Poké Kids in Galar who dress up
like Eevee...

And now whenever I see them, I think I understand
why they just wanna become Eevee!
episode_event_sub_ep_swsh_2021/6607_1201:
Oh, so it was you who originally caught that
Morpeko for Marnie?

Yeah. As her brother, I’m so glad it looks like it’s
shaped up to be a good partner.
What’s wrong? You look a bit sad.

Sorry. I was just thinking about something that
happened to a neighbor of mine.

His younger sister had a Pokémon that she really
loved, and it was given to her by their grandpa.

But then, this group that called itself Team Plasma
came and stole it.

So her brother went out and did his best to get
that Pokémon back for her.

But by the time they found it again, it had
forgotten all about her.

But she was still really happy to see her
Pokémon again.

That must’ve been hard... But y’know what?
I bet it’ll all be OK in the end!

It’s her one and only partner we’re talking about!
I’m sure they’ll be back to being best friends in
no time.

I was thinking that if anything ever happened that
separated you and Morpeko...
Oh come on—crying about it won’t help anything.
episode_event_sub_ep_swsh_2021/6608_1201:
Thanks a bunch, everyone! Thank you for all of
your support!

Wow, you’re so popular with the crowd!
No wonder they call you Miraculous Lisia.

Oh, hey there! Gloria, Marnie! You came
here, too?

All that cheering from your fans was amazing. It
reminded me a lot of my hometown.

Cheering made you think of home? Were you an
idol, Marnie?

No, it’s not that. There’s a group there called
Team Yell that would help cheer for me.
They used horns and banners to cheer her on!
Horns and banners? Like, fan merchandise?!

That’s amazing! I wanna try cheering like
that, too!

I know! How about I cheer for you at your next
match, Marnie?
Sure! But you’d better be on top of your game!

If you’re not one hundred percent into it, your
voice might not be heard!

Let’s practice it all together! Marnie, could you
teach us how to cheer?

Yeah. I’ll teach you some of the cheers Team Yell
are so proud of!
episode_event_sub_ep_swsh_2021/6609_1201:
I bet it’s because of the experience you’ve built
up battling so many Trainers!
Heheheh. Flattery will only make me blush, sonny!

You did a fine job, too! It’s not often a Trainer
becomes that strong at your age!

You were like a magnificent tree with its roots
firmly planted into the ground. It was an
excellent battle.

Yes, you showed us a marvelous battle. It takes
more than just your average hard work to get
that strong.

Could it be you had a very strong teacher
guiding you?
My teacher had a strong passion that rivals yours!

Is that so? If that’s the case, I’d love to battle them
someday.
I’m sure he’d love to battle you, too!

What a sight it would be to see you battling my
teacher! I’d love that!
And if possible, I’d also like in on the fun!

Sure! When the time comes, I will greet you with
a power even more refined than today’s!
